subject: Learning
title: Fixed vs Growth Mindset
description: A quick win: understand Fixed vs Growth Mindset.

hook.text: 'I'm just not a math person.' That single belief can cap a lifetime of mathematical potential.

buildup.text: Carol Dweck identified two mindsets: fixed (ability is innate) and growth (ability is developed).

discovery.text: Students with growth mindsets embrace challenges and persist through failure. Fixed-mindset students avoid them.

twist.text: Mindset interventions are shortâ€”sometimes just 25 minutesâ€”but they shift achievement trajectories.

climax.text: The biggest gains come from students who were told intelligence can grow, not that they're smart.

punchline.text: Believe you can grow and you will. Believe you can't and you won't.

quiz.question: What is a growth mindset?
options: The belief that ability can be developed through effort and practice
The belief that intelligence is fixed at birth
